intro: Phelipanche brachypoda, commonly known as the common bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in temperate regions, often found in grassy areas and along woodland edges. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branching. Phelipanche brachypoda is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting pollinators.
